la Warr Georgii Croft Capellani nostri Roberti Thorne Nicholei Thorne Ville noste Bristollie et Johannis Godryche clerici executoris testamenti Roberti Thorne defuncti in fundacione continuacione
et supportacione cuiusdam Scole gramaticalis in dicta Villa Bristollie aut in suburbiis eiusdem Ville pro pueris in eadem Scola erudiendis in bonis moribis et litteraturis pro meliori sustentacione
unious magistri et unius hostiarii sive duorum hostiariorum eisudem et aliarum rerum necessariarum ibidem faciendi ac gracia nostra speciali ac ex certa sciencia et mero moti nostris concessimus et

Henry the Eighth, by the grace of God, King of England and France, defender of the faith and lord of Ireland. To all those whom these present letters shall come. Greetings. Know that we considering the blessed purpose of our beloved to us Thomas West, knight, lord La Warr, George Croft our chaplain, Robert Thorne, Nicholas Thorne of our town of Bristol and John Godryche, clerk, executor of the will of Robert Thorne, deceased, in the foundation, continuation and support of a certain grammar school in the said town of Bristol or in the suburbs of the same town for children in the same school to be instructed in good customs and learning for the better maintenance of one master and one usher or two ushrs of the same and other things requisite in the same place made of our special grace and our certain knowledge and mere motion we have granted and given license for us and our heirs in so far as we are able to the mayor, burgesses and commonality of the saids town of Bristol and their successors that themselves and their successors be able to acquire and receive the house or hospital of Saint Bartholomew in our said town of Bristol, and the demense lands, manors, messuages, lands, tenements, gardens, orchards, meadows, pastures, pastures, rents, reversions, services with all their rights, profits and advantages which are now or any time past have been accepted or considered or parcel of the same hospital or which the said George Croft master of the said hospital had held or was enjoying in right of the same hospital in the said town of Bristol and in the parish of Clyfton, Stapulton, Sodbury and Wyckwarr in our county of Gloucestershire or elsewhere in the county of the said town of Bristol of Gloucestershire or elsewhere within our kindom of England to the yearly value of forty pounds over and above all charges and deductions both of the said Thomas West knight lord La Warr true patron and founder of the said hospital and of the said George Crofte master and custodian of the said house or hospital and of the brothers and sisters of the same house or hospital or concerning any one of these or concerning any other persons whatsoever having or claiming to have or henceforth anytime shall appertain some right, title or possession
